title: Technical Documentation and Proposals
description: Creating effective technical documents and project proposals

components.content: One-page overview of problem, solution, and value
components.tips: Write this last but place it first; busy executives may read only this

components.content: Clear definition of the problem and its impact
components.example: Current manual processes require 40 staff hours weekly, introduce errors, and create compliance risk.
We propose implementing an automated workflow system that integrates with existing tools via API.

components.content: System design, technologies, and integration points
components.tips: Use diagrams; include assumptions and constraints
Be realistic; include dependencies and risks

components.example: The project requires 2 senior developers and 1 project manager for 12 weeks.

components.tips: Quantify benefits where possible; acknowledge uncertainties

principles.poor: After analyzing various options and considering the constraints, we recommend Option A.
principles.improved: We recommend Option A. It best addresses the constraints because...

principles.poor: The system will be significantly faster.
principles.improved: The system will reduce response time from 2 seconds to under 200 milliseconds.

principles.example: The Application Programming Interface (API) enables... Subsequent references can use 'API.'
Diagrams for architecture, tables for comparisons, bullet points for lists

sections.title: Risk Communication

format.example: Integration delays | 2-week schedule slip | Medium | Early vendor engagement; parallel development track

principles: Include contingency plans for high-impact risks

writingTask.title: Technical Project Proposal
writingTask.prompt: Write an executive summary (200-250 words) for a proposal to implement a customer relationship management (CRM) system for a mid-sized company currently using spreadsheets.
writingTask.sampleResponse:
Executive Summary: CRM Implementation Proposal

Problem
Our sales team manages 5,000+ customer relationships using disconnected spreadsheets, resulting in data inconsistencies, lost opportunities, and approximately 15 hours per week spent on manual data consolidation. Customer response times average 48 hours—twice industry standard. We estimate this inefficiency costs $200,000 annually in lost sales and productivity.

Proposed Solution
We propose implementing Salesforce CRM, configured for our specific workflow, with full integration to our email and calendar systems. The solution will provide:
- Unified customer database accessible to all team members
- Automated lead tracking and opportunity management
- Real-time reporting and pipeline visibility
- Email integration for automatic activity logging

Expected Benefits
- 60% reduction in administrative time (9 hours/week reclaimed)
- Customer response time reduced to under 24 hours
- 15% increase in conversion rate through improved follow-up
- ROI breakeven within 8 months

Investment Required
- Implementation cost: $45,000 (one-time)
- Annual subscription: $24,000
- Training: $8,000
- Total first-year cost: $77,000

Timeline
- Phase 1 (Weeks 1-4): Configuration and data migration
- Phase 2 (Weeks 5-6): Integration and testing
- Phase 3 (Weeks 7-8): Training and go-live

Recommendation
We recommend proceeding with Phase 1 immediately to achieve go-live by end of Q2. Detailed implementation plan and risk assessment follow in Section 3.
